Our staff share their recommendations for Christmas gifts:

May 24

Alice Through the Looking Glass

The new Alice Through the Looking Glass film, released by Walt Disney Pictures on May 27 2016, is based on Through the Looking-Glass by Lewis Carroll and is the sequel to the 2010 film Alice in Wonderland. In honour of the latest film, here are some Alice related books and DVDs to investigate.

May 3

Brave New Reads 2016

Brave New Reads recommends 6 challenging books for you to read this summer.

May 3

New fiction for May 2016

Featuring Peter James and Marina Lewycka.

New fiction for April 2016

New novels from Joanne Harris, David Baldacci and Irvine Welsh.

March 2

William Shakespeare: Celebrating his 400th anniversary

Shakespeare Week runs from 14-20 March. Take a look at how the Bard has influenced books, film and music until the modern day.

March 1

New fiction for March 2016

Anticipated new novels from L. S. Hilton, Wilbur Smith and Tracy Chevalier.

Blockbusters for 2016

This time last year the buzz was all about something called The girl on the train by Paula Hawkins, which went on to become a runaway bestseller. Here are a few first novels due in early 2016 that their publishers have high hopes for.
